title: Each menu item can have drop-down megamenus on hover on desktop
custom_preconds: GIVEN navigation to https://www.mlb.com
custom_steps: When viewing the menu items on the Nav
custom_expected: Each menu item can have drop-down megamenus on hover on desktop at 1200px+

title: Hovering only works at 1200px+
custom_preconds: GIVEN navigation to https://www.mlb.com
custom_steps: WHEN sizing the viewport at 1200px+
custom_expected: THEN hovering over "NEWS" in the navigation will open the megamenu and display "IN THIS SECTION."

title: Megamenus can support 10 items before it goes to a second column within dropdown
custom_preconds: GIVEN navigation to https://www.mlb.com
custom_steps: When viewing megamenus in the Nav
custom_expected: Then Megamenus can support 10 items before it goes to a second column within dropdown

title: All expanded items will be condensed and left-aligned under each item
custom_preconds: GIVEN navigation to https://www.mlb.com
custom_steps: When viewing the expanded items in the Nav
custom_expected: Then All expanded items will be condensed and left-aligned under each item

title: Megamenu items are featured as MenuItems in Forge outputs
custom_preconds: GIVEN navigation to https://www.mlb.com
custom_steps: When viewing megamenu items
custom_expected: MenuItems are from Forge outputs

title: Items should be featured on the front-end in the order they are being returned
custom_preconds: GIVEN navigation to https://www.mlb.com
custom_steps: When viewing items on the front end
custom_expected: Then items should be showed in the same order they are returned from Forge

title: Text field displays the name/title of each nav item
custom_preconds: GIVEN navigation to https://www.mlb.com
custom_steps: When viewing the title of each item
custom_expected: Then text field displays the name/title of each nav item

title: Link refers to nav items URL
custom_preconds: Given the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com/
custom_steps: When viewing items in the nav
custom_expected: Then the links should refer to the nav items URL

title: Titles display as menu items with no link field
custom_preconds: Given the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com/
custom_steps: When viewing the menu item titles
custom_expected: Then titles should display as menu items with no link field

title: Menu button is present on all viewports and devices
custom_preconds: Given the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com
custom_steps: When viewing the Nav
custom_expected: Then Menu button is present on all viewports and devices

title: Clicking on the menu button opens hamburger menu
custom_preconds: Given the user navigates to MLB or Club homepage
custom_steps: When viewing the nav menu button
custom_expected: Then clicking the button opens the hamburger menu

title: Search displays at the top of the open hamburger menu
custom_preconds: Given the user navigates to MLB or Club homepage
custom_steps: When viewing the open hamburger menu of the Nav
custom_expected: Then search displays at the top of the open hamburger menu

title: Open hamburger menu displays items in the same order as the Nav
custom_preconds: Given the user navigates to MLB or Club homepage
custom_steps: When viewing the hamburger menu items
custom_expected: Then the the items should show in the same order as they do on the Nav

title: Top Nav container should be responsive
custom_preconds: GIVEN navigation to https://www.mlb.com
custom_steps: When viewing the top nav component
custom_expected: Then the Nav should be responsive where items are being simplified as it gets smaller. (XL vs XS)

title: Verify logos and icons are rendering
custom_preconds: Given the user navigates to MLB or Club homepage
custom_steps: When viewing the Nav/ Hamburger menu
custom_expected: Then verify logos and icons are rendering

title: Allow the MLB Nav to go the full width of the page
custom_preconds: Given the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com/
custom_steps: When viewing the MLB Nav
custom_expected: Then allow the MLB Nav to go the full width of the page

title: Limit nav to 1680 pixels (width of skins)
custom_preconds: Given the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com/
custom_steps: When viewing the MLB Nav
custom_expected: Then Limit nav to 1680 pixels (width of skins)

title: MLB Nav should go full width in XL and L viewports
custom_preconds: Given the use navigates to https://www.mlb.com/
custom_steps: When in XL and L viewports
custom_expected: Then MLB Nav should go full width in XL and L viewports

title: Side menu's "dropdown" items will automatically be expanded once main item is tapped on mobile devices
custom_preconds: Given the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com/
custom_steps: When viewing the nav on mobile devices
custom_expected: Then Side menu's "dropdown" items will automatically be expanded once main item is tapped on mobile devices

title: Tapping an item will display that item's additional items
custom_preconds: Given the user navigates to https://www.mlb.com/
custom_steps: When tapping on an item in the Nav
custom_expected: Then Tapping an item will display that item's additional items

title: Hovering over a side nav item and icon will expand that item's children items on Desktop
custom_preconds: Given the user navigates to MLB/Club Homepages
custom_steps: When hovering over a side nav item
custom_expected: Then the icon will expand that items children items

title: Clicking on a side nav item will take user directly to that page (ex: News, Schedule, Scores)
custom_preconds: Given the user navigates to MLB/Club Nav
custom_steps: When clicking on a side nav item
custom_expected: Then user is taken directly to clicked page (ex: News, Schedule, Scores)

title: Verify sticky nav on Desktop
custom_preconds: Given the user navigates to MLB/Club Homepage
custom_steps: WHen viewing the Nav on desktop
custom_expected: Then Verify sticky nav on Desktop

title: The top nav should be sticky to the top of the page when user scrolls down (desktop only)
custom_preconds: Given the user navigates to MLB/Club Homepage
custom_steps: When user scrolls on desktop
custom_expected: Then The top nav should be sticky to the top of the page

title: Sticky nav will always behave the same no matter where the user is on the page
custom_preconds: Given the user navigates to MLB/Club Homepage
custom_steps: WHen the user is anywhere on the page
custom_expected: Then stick nav always behaves the same

title: Side Nav and Megamenus will have same functionality
custom_preconds: Given the user navigates to MLB/Club Homepage
custom_steps: When viewing the side Nav and Megamenus
custom_expected: Then they have the same functionality
